Metadata.Title: Require SSL for All Private Pages
Metadata.DirectLink: Require SSL for All Private Pages

Content.Data:
Applies To

  • ASP.NET 4.0

What to Do

Require SSL for all private pages.

Why

SSL should be used to protect all pages that handle sensitive data, including all pages that use authentication or authorization features, to prevent unauthorized information disclosure.

When

Use SSL to secure all private pages.

How

To enable SSL on all sensitive pages:

  1. Identify sensitive pages. Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive information, including all pages that use authentication or authorization features.

  2. Enable a HTTPS binding for the site. Start the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Right-click on the site and select "Edit bindings...". Add a binding of the "https" type.

  3. Enable SSL for each folder containing sensitive pages. Start the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Navigate the folders with sensitive pages. Double-click on the SSL icon in the right pane and enable SSL for the folder.
